pages.text: Ciurcopterus is a basal pterygotid eurypterid. Compared to other early pterygotids, Ciurcopterus is relatively large but is massively dwarfed by its later relatives. It is short and wide with a flattened telson, a characteristic feature of its family. Pterygotids also have robust chelicerae, but these have not been preserved in Ciurcopterus. Although it has all the features that define it as a pterygotid,
its appendages are more similar to that of the primitive pterygotioid Slimonia. It lived in the late Silurian of North America in shallow, stromatolite-abundant environments.
